com.google.code.sagetvaddons.sagealert.shared
Interface ReporterService

All Superinterfaces:
com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.RemoteService
All Known Implementing Classes:
ReporterServiceImpl
@RemoteServiceRelativePath(value="ReporterService")
public interface ReporterService
extends com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.RemoteService

Interface for RPC reporter operations. A reporter is the generic term used to describe the connection settings for a notification system.

Version:
$Id: ReporterService.java 1022 2010-09-19 01:06:11Z derek@battams.ca $
Author:
dbattams

Method Summary
 void delete(List<NotificationServerSettings> settings)
          Delete the list of reporters from the data store; also removes them from any events they may have been listening to
 List<NotificationServerSettings> getAllReporters()
          Get a list of all the reporters registered with the server
 List<NotificationServerSettings> getReporters(String type)
          Get a list of all reporters for a given notification system
 void save(List<NotificationServerSettings> settings)
          Save the list of reporters to the data store
 

Method Detail

getAllReporters

List<NotificationServerSettings> getAllReporters()
Get a list of all the reporters registered with the server

Returns:
The list of all reporters registered with the server

getReporters

List<NotificationServerSettings> getReporters(String type)
Get a list of all reporters for a given notification system

Parameters:
type - A description (FQ class name) of the notification system
Returns:
A list of all reporters for the given notification system; the list may be empty, but not null

save

void save(List<NotificationServerSettings> settings)
Save the list of reporters to the data store

Parameters:
settings - The list of reporters to be saved

delete

void delete(List<NotificationServerSettings> settings)
Delete the list of reporters from the data store; also removes them from any events they may have been listening to

Parameters:
settings - The list of reporters to be deleted
